nodes.text: LEGO Star Wars: The Han Solo Affair

LEGO Star Wars: The Han Solo Affair, also known as Star Wars Episode V½, is a short stop-motion animated film using LEGO characters that was released in 2002. It was created by Spite Your Face Productions Ltd and hosted on the Brickfilms website. It could also be viewed on LEGO's website and YouTube.com.
From between the scenes of The Empire Strikes Back, it's the Han Solo Affair!
Han Solo's friends hatch a plan to rescue him from the clutches of Darth Vader and Boba Fett.
Will they succeed? Find out in this wacky Star Wars adventure!

As Han Solo is frozen in carbonite, his friends Chewbacca and Leia look on in dismay. R2-D2 uses an energy blast on the ceiling to make sparks rain down. A madcap chase around Cloud City ensues, with Luke Skywalker and Darth Vader joining in. Eventually, Han ends up being tractored in by Fett, who then escapes in Slave I, with all the other characters passing out.
